Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/22/2017
Convenient to everything, everywhere, in the RTP/Triangle area. Pet friendly with lots of walking trails. After the offices clear out on the nights and weekends, it feels like you are in the middle of nowhere. They have a well-maintained saltwater pool that is open year-round and is HUGE! Nice units; nice amenities; nice grounds; nice people. You even have a high liklihood of running into a food truck on one of your walks! What more could you ask for?

2015 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/18/2017
I really enjoy living at Heights at Meridian. The complex is beautifully maintained, and I really enjoy the outside landscaping, and aesthetic of the buildings/interiors. It is located close to South Point but not to far from downtown, making it a great spot for commuters. The maintenance staff do a fantastic job answering your call, and it is clear they work hard to maintain the property! I would definitely recommend others to rent here.

Verified Manager06/23/2017

Hello, Thank you for the review! We are glad you like the community, staff, your apartment, and the location. Let us know if we can do anything to help out. Best, Community Manager

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Verified Resident
2015 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/21/2017
I have lived here for almost two years, and so far, it has been above average compared to other apartment complexes I've lived in. The community has nice amenities, including a nice pool that doesn't get too crowded most days, and a workout room that provides a nice variety of equipment if you don't have a gym membership. The maintenance staff is great- they're quick to fix any issues, and they're very kind and polite. Noise bleeding through walls/ceilings has been the biggest annoyance for me, but it's no worse than most apartment complexes. The price is a little higher than a lot of other apartment complexes, but I think it's worth it with the quality of the community and apartment amenities.
I have lived here for almost two years, and so far, it has been above average compared to other apartment complexes I've lived in. The community has nice amenities, including a nice pool that doesn't get too crowded most days, and a workout room that provides a nice variety of equipment if you don't have a gym membership. The maintenance staff is great- they're quick to fix any issues, and they're very kind and polite. Noise bleeding through walls/ceilings has been the biggest annoyance for me, but it's no worse than most apartment complexes. The price is a little higher than a lot of other apartment complexes, but I think it's worth it with the quality of the community and apartment amenities. Read less

Report
Verified Resident
2015 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/02/2017
The apartment complex if fairly new and it has a nice walking path circling the Meridian campus and around two man-made lake. It's pretty good if you have dogs and the residents are polite and friendly. Though the breakfast is oversold for what they are, and the common area isn't very conducive for hanging out due to lack of seating area, they are clean. The resident get-together ideas are fine, but when you go, it's not very welcoming, people just stay by their familiar groups and the management doesn't really facilitate these events and make it more inviting. The office folks seem to be nice, sometimes overly cheerful that edges on fake, but most offices are like that. Still, it would be nicer if they're a bit more sincere and don't feel like they need to impress us. Caring attitude naturally exudes respect, so it would be better if they don't feel pressured to put up a painful front. It's nice that they provide a small white towel for the gym, and sometimes there're water. It's small, but sufficient. Within the apartments, the kitchen and bathroom are oddly large in space. Overall the residents are quite and friendly, but sometimes some would play loud music late hours and dogs would yap. There is no divide between non/residents parking spot, which isn't bad until the parking spaces sometimes fill out that you can't park near your apartment. It feels sometimes some people visit so often, they should be paying rent. I do enjoy having occasional guests around and them not having to park so far, but some residents seem to abuse this. The immediate surrounding is ok, but once you get on hwy 55, there isn't any great grocery stores within 5min drive. The location is convenient since it's right next to I-40. If location and if you have a pet, this would be a good place.

Report
Verified Resident
2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/18/2015
The Heights at Meridian is a wonderful community to live in. The grounds and common areas are always kept in pristine shape. Maintenance issues, in my time living here, have been addressed within 2 days tops. The only cons to living in this community is the location - it's a bit far from grocery stores and shops and my building is located right next to I-40 so I can't frequent the back patio without much noise. Southpoint (a great location for eateries, shopping and movies) is only an exit away however! Traffic can get backed up on 40 but if you're used to any usual traffic that's alright, I love the complex enough to tolerate it. Oh, you also have to buy track light bulbs for the kitchen, the community will not cover cost on these so it can add up.

If you can "get in" and live here, you are very, very lucky. This apartment complex is beautiful (lakes, water fountains, superior landscaping,) well maintained (excellent management,) and your neighbors are intelligent professionals. I lived here for almost one year and when job circumstances required me to move to another city, everything was handled graciously, kindly and professionally. Fees were waived (pet rent) and the accounting adjustments, a lot of extra work for the staff, were completed correctly. I miss living here very, very much because the location is convenient to the major highways, grocery shopping, Southpoint Mall, downtown Durham and all the colleges/universities. My apartment was quiet, beautiful and peaceful. The maintenance folks are kind, personable, and very responsive. "Get in" if you can and stay. It's an ideal living space. Again, I miss living here very, very much.

Verified Resident
2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/25/2015
Beautiful apartments with wonderful amenities. The floor plans are excellent, with large bathrooms, kitchens, and closets. The cabinets, counter tops, and wood flooring are all extremely high quality and very superior to most apartment homes. Our only complaint is that the walls are a bit thin, so others can be heard above and below, as well as in the hallways. Sometimes cars from the parking lot are also audible. We also wish that the clubhouse and gym were available 24 hours, rather than during a restricted time frame. We love the location and the community. The running trail is great and there's plenty of places to eat and shop nearby. Plus it's super easy to jump on Hwy 40 and get pretty much anywhere. Overall, one of the best apartment complexes in the area.

The Heights at Meridian is everything we wanted in apartment complex living. Great location, quiet neighbors and well maintained common areas. The interior of the apartment is well constructed and feels very spacious. The neutral tones can appeal to any resident's tastes. The appliances are of high quality as well as the floor finishes and kitchen and bath counters. There has always been a quick response to maintenance requests and follow up to their completion. We love the spacious balcony and the chance to enjoy the outside. There are many walking trails within the complex as well as access to other walking trails around the Meridian Parkway corporate community. We were very impressed upon our first visit to Heights at Meridian and we continue to be impressed. It is a perfect fit for us.

Leasing

Heights at Meridian Apartments are luxury apartment homes featuring one, two and three bedroom floor plans. Situated in the heart of the Research Triangle Park, we are located at I-40 and Hwy 55 in Durham, North Carolina. Heights at Meridian is designed with walking trails, lakes and expansive landscaped grounds. Apartment amenities include gourmet kitchens with stainless steel appliances and granite counter tops, custom flooring and cabinet options and over-sized walk-in closets. The community features a resort style salt water pool with fountains, fitness center, poolside grilling station and outdoor fireplace. Prices and availability may be subject to change. Professionally managed by Cottonwood Residential, Home at Last.
